newsitem.title: GERMANY: Agency would back E.German aluminium firm rescue.
newsitem.headline: Agency would back E.German aluminium firm rescue.

text.p: German privatisation agency BvS said on Friday it would back rescue attempts for the bankrupt east German aluminium processor Rackwitz, provided a feasible operating plan was presented and a future owner found.
BvS, the successor to the Treuhand agency, made the pledge after initial talks with the plant's official receiver and representatives of the states of Saxony and Saxony Anhalt.
Representatives of the two German states said they would provide interim finance and back bank loans for the company in a bid to help maintain production and secure some 450 jobs.
Talks would be continued, BvS said.
Rackwitz, which filed for bankruptcy proceedings on December 17, produces aluminium sections mostly for residential buildings and foil at two sites in Rackwitz (Saxony) and Merseburg (Saxony Anhalt).
Receiver Winfrid Andres has put the firm's credit needs at 15 million marks to survive the next six months and has said serious bidders have signalled their interest in buying it.
